description: This page organizes our Spring 2025 reading group on semiadditivity and its applications. We meet on Fridays at 2:00pm in Harvard SC 309. Open invite.
terms: E<sub>n</sub>-MODULE LOCAL SYSTEMS + f<sub>!</sub> ⊣ f<sup>*</sup> ⊣ f<sub>*</sub>

talks.title: Trivial Notions
talks.description: The greatest stories do not begin with oo-category theory. Ours is no exception---the germs of semiadditivity subsist willingly upon ordinary categories, begging for swab and cultivation. We will start our seminar by documenting some of the most basic semiadditive phenomena (in particular, negative one and zero semiadditivity) as it is expressible in elementary and ordinary language, and we will anticipate the uses of higher algebra to extend the theory.

talks.title: I am NORMal and can be trusted with BOTH MY LEFT AND RIGHT HANDS, I
talks.description: In this session, we will make the first definition of semiadditivity using AMBIDEXTERITY AND NORMS. The focus will be on intuition. In particular, we will BLACK BOX the general theory of norms, to be treated in the next session.

talks.title: I am NORMal and can be trusted with BOTH MY LEFT AND RIGHT HANDS, II
Differential Forms and de Rham Cohomology
